newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Societe Generale initiates Argentina's Astra.
newsitem.headline: Societe Generale initiates Argentina's Astra.

text.p: Societe Generale Securities said it started Friday coverage of Argentine oil company Astra CAPSA, controlled by Spain's Repsol, as "neutral".

Although Repsol purchased a controlling 37.7 stake in Astra a year ago, head of Latin American Research Vinod Sehgal and analyst James Rice said they "remain unconvinced that Astra's minority shareholders stand to benefit in 1997-1998."
Recent acquisitions by Repsol are less an attempt to create shareholder value than to gain critical mass in South America, Societe Generale said.
"For more patient investors with a five year plus time frame, Repsol's long term strategies may appear more attractive," it said.
Sehgal and Rice believe Astra's stock should trade at a 10 percent discount to its net asset valuation of $2.44 per share.
